content.description:
White Rain is a fantastic mixed pro climb; one of the few to get 5 stars in Randy's guide book.

The route begins on a large boulder uphill from

Mojave Queen

(5.11a). It is prudent to stick clip the first bolt before stepping onto the steep face. Sustained face climbing past six bolts on fine patina brings the climber to cruxy moves that gain the short finger/hand crack. A few challenging moves in the crack lead to the top.
content.protection: Pro includes QD's for 6 bolts, a few small TCU's (#1 - #3), and a few small - medium cams for a short crack to finish the climb. Rappel from a two bolt anchor with chains/rings at the top.

content.description: A runout bolted face climb on quality stone to the right of At Your Pleasure (5.8). Most of the hardest moves on the route are decently protected, but falling from anywhere except right at a bolt could be disastrous, especially considering the long hike out. 30' + groundfall potential getting to the second bolt. A fun line though, and easy enough to TR if you're not feeling up to the lead. The crux may be a height-dependent/reachy move past the third bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts protect nearly 80' of climbing. This is NOT a sport climb, though it is equipped with a bolted rap anchor. An optional small-med cam can be placed before the third bolt.
content.location: Starts on the large ledge near the middle of Upper Walt's Rocks, about 40' right of the start for At Your Pleasure (5.8).You can rappel down this route/set a TR by climbing AYP first.

content.description: Clip a bolt and then launch into excellent 5.10 crack climbing that is right slanting offering up challenging locks and thin face for your feet.  The crux is definitely the face climbing after the crack, but is well protected.
content.protection: Standard rack to #3 camalot.  3 bolts.  Build an anchor.
content.location: Climbs the leftmost of the 3 prominent parallel cracks on the Upper Walts face.  Begins on top of ledge just left of large chimney where Mojave Queen starts.  You can climb the chimney (haven't done this), climb the sporty route to the left of the chimney, or access via rappell after topping out on White Rain or Mojave Queen (preferable).  2 raps to the ground from the top with 60M rope.  Anchors are to the left of the topout.  See photo of all routes in Upper Walts Rocks for location.

content.description: This route begins off of a large boulder on the northwest face of Upper Walt's Rock. Difficult moves (crux) past two bolts (stick clip first bolt or small TCU) through discontinuous seams gain a thin crack that veers left. Continue up the crack (easier climbing) to the top. A worthwhile climb -  2.5 out of 5 stars.
content.protection: QD's for two bolts (1/4"), small TCU's (#0 - #4), small stoppers, and a few medium sized cams to 2". Medium cams are needed for an anchor. Walk east and slightly north to an east - west running gully and down climb to the base of the route.

content.description:
This premier Walt's Rock classic begins left of

White Rain

(5.11a) at the base of the formation. Begin in a low-angle chimney and climb to a small ledge. Traverse right (bolt protected) to gain a nice hand crack (5.10). Follow the hand crack to its end where spectacular steep face climbing (crux) is protected by three bolts. The movement and position are exceptional on this route!
content.protection: QD's for four bolt hangers, stoppers, TCU's, and Cams to 2" provide great pro. A two bolt anchor / rappel station is at the top.

content.description: This is the obvious crack just right of Drag Queen. Powerful moves off the deck in a steep fingers / hand crack gain a pod. Awkward moves out of the pod lead to some nice fist jams to the top. Some loose rock but overall an excellent climb.
content.protection: Primarily small to large cams (to 4.5") and stoppers are sufficient for pro. Small to Medium cams are required to build an anchor. Rappel off of the anchor for Drag Queen.

content.description: This route starts up hill and left of white rain, a hand crack goes out the left side of a huge chimney with chockstones. Follow this straight up through a nice jamming section to a slot with a nolina. Continue past the bush to the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack up to 2.5 inch, nuts too. Runners.Trad anchor . Rap off bolts for nearby sporty climb with 60 m rope.
content.location:
Hike up and left of

White Rain

about 100 yds  till you see a huge chimney/gully with chockstone. The route starts on the right side of the chimney.

Easy approach from the top of Perfect Fingers.

content.description: This stunning climb begins left of Crack Queen on the Upper Walt's formation (it is mistakenly labeled as #2383 in Randy's guide). The crux moves, on slightly overhanging rock, occur between the first and second bolt. After the crux, beautiful 5.10 face climbing (natural pro and 2 bolts) on dark reddish brown patina exists to the top.
content.protection: QD's for five bolt hangers and small TCU's or stoppers provide adequate pro. A two bolt anchor/rappel station is on top.

content.description: 1995 Budget Closure follows a left-slanting dike with good protection. The route starts with a jump/mantle onto a large chickenhead knob. Take care pulling the crux after the 2nd? bolt - the crucial crimp hold is cracked all the way through and may not last forever.
content.location: Situated on a lower block that terminates at a ledge halfway up the middle of Upper Walt's Rock. This route finishes at the start to Where Were You (5.10a). Easily set up as a TR.
